content.description: Ten Mile Radius is a fun route with sustained face moves. Pull through the crux mid-route, then enjoy gradually easier climbing to the anchors.
content.location: There are three bolted lines on the right side of The Inventions in Nature Wall. This is the farthest left of the three.

content.description:
This is the first route on the wall. We have no information on first ascent or history, so please comment if you know anything about it.

Start on the sloping ledge, and head to the hand and finger crack curving right and up. It is worth doing if you have the gear with you.
content.protection: A standard rack and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is the center route on the wall, following the hand crack between "

Fantastic Beasts

" and "

Ten Mile Radius

."

content.description:
Clip a sharee first bolt with

Evacuation Route

, then step left on small holds for your feet and hands. Pull on thin holds through the second bolt crux. Follow up to a steepening seam, reaching for angled holds. Finish up through a steep upper panel with an awkward crack to your right for a bailout foot.

This shares anchors with

Evacuation Route

.
content.location:
It shares a first bolt with

Evacuation Route

then splits off left to head straight up the main face of the right side wall of the formation.

content.description: An awkward start leads to great face climbing. Chimney your way through the water groove to gain the clean face above. Stay right and true to the face on the final headwall for the 5.11 finish, or skirt left to the arete, and keep the climbing at 5.10. Both options are great and within reach of the bolts.
content.location: On the left side of The Inventions of Nature Wall, there are 3 bolted lines. This is the rightmost of the three.

content.description:
There is a mix of styles here. Begin on the large, right-angling seam protected by bolts (first bolts is shared with

Harry Bones

, .10b/c). Pull up and over to a small ledge a the base of a thin crack. A couple small cams (0.3-0.5 BD) protect the crack. Pull out of the crack on large, angled holds to reach the base of a roof. Search for small but good holds that pull the roof. Finish on easier rock to the anchors (shared with

Harry Bones

, .10b/c).
content.protection: 7 bolts, 0.3-0.5 BD cams, and a bolted anchor.
content.location: It is the first route on the right side wall. Belay on a small rock shelf just in from the grassy slope.

content.description:
From a similar belay to

Fantastic Beasts

, start easy up a slot to the corner of a small roof. Pull around the slab, and work up and left on fantastic, incut holds for 20 feet or so. Finish pulling through some flaps and flakes to the anchors.
content.location:
From the main right wall, scramble around the rib of rock extending to a grassy slope below. From here, you drop down into the slot where

Fantastic Beasts

(right bolt line) and Eagleview Middle School (left bolt line) begin. There is a third bolted line on this wall (

Bucolic

), beginning lower in the slot on another rib of rock.

content.description: Bucolic is an enjoyable climb in a picturesque (bucolic?) setting. Low-angle slab leads to a crux section at the roof/layback.
content.location: There are three bolted lines on the left side of The Inventions in Nature Wall. This one is the farthest left. Descend the gully a short ways to reach the starting moves.
